alert.note: Alert for Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 7:20PM CDT until April 24 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Prairie River near Taconite affecting Itasca County. Snake River near Pine City affecting Pine County. Mississippi River at Fort Ripley affecting Crow Wing and Morrison Counties. Mississippi River At Aitkin affecting Crow Wing and Aitkin Counties. .Warm temperatures last week caused rapid snowmelt from a deep snowpack. This resulted in strong increase river flows. Cooler temperatures have allowed some rivers to crest however additional precipitation is expected Thursday which may cause delayed river crests. Snow is expected for northern tier basins. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Prairie River near Taconite. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Water level nears cabin on Lower Lawrence lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM CDT Wednesday was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river has crested and it will fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.0 feet on 04/21/1971. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Prairie River Taconite 10.0 11.0 Wed 6 pm CDT 10.9 10.6 10.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Thursday evening by 715 PM CDT.
